column5: I fish the same water 90% of the time and have yet to get a WASS/gps and do fine without one, but I would be blind without a fishfinder.  For all you guys that have both or have used both before, what sytem would you choose if it could only be one or the other, a GPS or fishfinder ? I know having both is nice, but what do you depend on more ?
need my fishfinder.......... can't live without it

I guess if I could I would get both.  You never know when you will be fishing another body of water and then you would wish you had it.  I think the GPS portion as come down in price quite a bit the past few years. I would be lost with both.
I ll take a handheld with a navionics chip any day of the week
Gotta have the depthfinder.   Those walleye are at a certain depth on a shoal the gps isnt accurate enough.
Fishfinder for me.    Suspended fish eh ?   Where have I heard that phrase before ?
well thats a no-brainer   lowrance 339 IGPS/dumb ass...... all the way

neither. I fish blind, and probably always will. To me it seems like being able to see the fish is just unfair. I like the challenge of trying different patterns untill you locate the fish. Try it one time, turn off the fishfinder on a lake you dont fish alot and try to catch something, if youre used to always having the electronics you might find it more difficult than you expect.
